info.game_comments:
2001 College Championship quarterfinal game 1.
From the campus at UCLA.

(1, 1).clue: "You can go to hell! I'm going to Texas", said this coonskin cap man after losing an 1835 Tennessee election

(2, 1).clue: 2001:"December 7, 1941:A day that shall live in infamy"

(3, 1).clue: Left my pot of this square, stuffed pasta baking in the oven; BRB

(4, 1).clue: Number of humps on a Bactrian camel

(5, 1).clue: Premier is an alternate title for this head of a parliamentary government

(6, 1).clue: In Portugal, Italy or Romania, you'll find the basic word for water starts with this letter

(1, 2).clue: In 2001 this Dallas Cowboy quarterback retired after 3 Super Bowl wins & 10 concussions

(2, 2).clue: 2001:"His love is real, but he is not"

(3, 2).clue: My trial's in an hour for this type of illegal entry onto private land; CUL8R (I hope)

(4, 2).clue: According to Genesis, the number of women on Noah's ark

(5, 2).clue: Honorary title of the man seen here

(6, 2).clue: In Germany, frau is used for married women & this term of address for unmarried ones

(2, 3).clue: 2000:"There's nothing more determined than poultry with a plan"

(3, 3).clue: Mom's yelling from downstairs; since Junior was born she's had this type of depression--TTYL

(4, 3).clue: Number of locks in the Suez canal

(6, 3).clue: In Israel, this day of the week is Yom Rishon, literally "first day"

(1, 4).clue: Karla Faye Tucker, the first woman "Tex-ecuted" since 1863, was put to death by this process in 1998

(2, 4).clue: 2000:"After a night they can't remember, comes a day they'll never forget"

(4, 4).clue: Number of moonless planets in our solar system

(6, 4).clue: If you hear the following sentence, you're in this country:(Sofia delivers the clue in a tongue foreign to us but familiar to her.)

(1, 5).clue: Members of this group that formally began in the 1830s were hired as protection from Indian attacks

(4, 5).clue: Number of oxygen atoms in a molecule of ozone

(5, 5).clue: A male heir apparent to a throne commonly uses this 2-word title, as Naruhito does

(6, 5).clue: If you're offered a nice bowl of sopa tarascan, you're probably in Michoacan in this country

(1, 1).clue: These 2 prefixes divide sociology as well as economics into broader & narrower focuses

(3, 1).clue: It's what the VC stands for in VCR

(6, 1).clue: Using timber from Mount Ida, Epeius built this object that won the Trojan War for the Greeks

(1, 2).clue: Of the basic class divisions, it's the one the most Americans say they're in
